intro: Mimulopsis marronina, commonly known as the yellow mimulopsis, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Lythraceae, which includes plants such as willows and pomegranates. The plant is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils along stream banks and in open woodlands. Mimulopsis marronina is often found in areas with partial to full sunlight and is adapted to a variety of soil types.
